1 hour ago, 322997am said:

Firstly, as most devices have 2gb ram the game needs to stop dumping everything onto the ram.

Try running stock KSP with the lowest texture sizes, you might be surprised at how small the memory footprint is.

If console didn't work so well, why would phones work? I think the port to console was the worst decision SQUAD has ever made, ever. We have an upset player base, a terrible port, and worst of all, us PC players are restricted because they have to make the update work for both us and them. It's just like Black Ops 3. Could've been a lot better if Treyarch just made it for Xbone, PS4, and PC, but they made it on the 360 and PS3 too, ruining what the game could've become. If they make it for phones, the port would be 100x worse than console, would make SQUAD little to no money, and further restrict what us PC players can get. I honestly think SQUAD should abandon console for good, and just focus on their most successful and best platform, the PC.

I can't see KSP as a game being practical for mobile phones or tablets.  Even if/when the hardware performance is no longer an issue, the controls would be very fiddly at best and the novelty of being able to play on my phone would wear thin fairly quickly. 

I could see an official KSP app being worthwhile though,  that contains the KSPedia and mission planning tools etc. and maybe some simplified vessel design functions/aids to check out basic ship designs/configurations as part of the mission planning suite.

We've had this discussion many moons ago.

On 11/25/2016 at 4:25 PM, 322997am said:

Well, the game needs a complete redesign for it to work. Firstly, as most devices have 2gb ram the game needs to stop dumping everything onto the ram. Also, your CPU DESTROYS the best tablets on the market. Ok:

Have you looked at the specs of the PS4/Xbox1?  While I don't think any tablet ships 8 cores, don't be surprised if they are already shipping 4 cores with twice the power of a bobcat.  Those things [bobcats] are wimpy (but seriously powerful for something like 2mm^2).  The GPUs of the consoles might be mightier than the typical tablet (less sure about shield), but they really don't need as much resolution (although plenty have more than UHD TVs).

The PC might be wildly better, but KSP>1.1 doesn't really need that much CPU or GPU.  Memory might be more of an issue, but KSP has shown to fit into 2GB with a lot of room for mods (and android doesn't  take up all that much.  And don't forget that the tablet will be using OpenGL and not directX).

I'd need to plug in a keyboard/mouse/joystick (console control a distant second option).  Preferably a table that has a [likely tiny/flat] keyboard flipped around on the back, but still lets me plug in the real deal if available.  I can't imagine trying to control a rocket by accelerometer.

In my opinion:

Never.
